business.headline: Gold flashing a big warning signal: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu says amid rising pricesAs gold prices soar globally, Zoho's Sridhar Vembu raises a red flag. Does the surge signal investor anxiety and eroding trust in the system or reveal a deeper economic fault line?

Gold prices hit record high ahead of Dhanteras, see Rs 3,200 hike in DelhiTraders said gold buying activity picked up sharply as stockists built fresh positions on expectations of higher sales during the festive season.

Why silver utensils, not coins, could help make more moneyWith the price of silver at a record high, silverware might be a potential tax-saving alternative to bars and coins. Personal-use silver utensils are exempt from capital gains tax when sold. Here's what chartered accountants have to say about silver utensils helping investors save on taxes.
Sensex ends 484 points higher, Nifty above 25,700; Asian Paints jumps 4%The S&P BSE Sensex settled 484.53 points higher at 83,952.19, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 124.55 points to close at 25,709.85.

Diwali 2025: From ETFs to SGBs, 5 smart ways to invest in goldWith gold prices at record levels this Diwali, many people are rethinking whether to buy jewellery or look at smarter investment routes. From gold ETFs to SGBs, there are safer and more practical ways to invest without worrying about storage or high-making charges.

Coca-Cola eyes $1 billion IPO for Indian bottling arm: ReportThe discussions are still in early stages, and Coca-Cola has not yet appointed bankers for the deal. The listing could take place as early as next year, though details such as timing, structure, and offer size are still being worked out, the report said.

Why keeping all your money in saving account may be a costly mistake, explains CAMany people believe that money parked in a savings account is the safest option. But an expert warns that this habit could quietly drain your wealth over time, especially when inflation eats into low returns.
EPFO rule change: What's new in PF withdrawals and how it affects youConfused about the new EPFO rules? This guide covers every update, from withdrawal limits to pension changes, in one place.

Dhanteras 2025: Know gold and silver rates in your city before you buyDhanteras is a day when many Indian families choose to bring home gold or silver, believing it invites prosperity and good fortune. From jewellery and coins to small utensils, shoppers often plan their purchases in advance. But with prices running high this season, checking the latest rates in your city has become more important than ever.

Diwali 2025: Planning to buy or gift gold? Know the tax rules firstFrom coins to jewellery, gold remains a favourite Diwali buy. However, not everyone realises that certain tax rules apply when you purchase or gift gold. Knowing these in advance can help you avoid unexpected trouble later.

Sensex surges 700 points: What is the stock market rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 647.53 points to 94,115.19 around 11:30 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 182.35 points to trade at 25,767.65. Most broader market indices also advanced, though volatility remained elevated.

Buying just gold on Dhanteras? Why you should consider a mutual fund SIPAs Dhanteras's theme shifts from gold to goal-based investing, here is a detailed guide to help investors make smarter, purpose-driven financial choices this festive season.

Big bullion days: Why are gold and silver reaching record highs every day?In India, the timing for the gold and silver rally could not have been more interesting, as the surge comes just ahead of Dhanteras, when buying gold is considered auspicious.

Gold at Rs 1.3 lakh, silver doubles: Is it safe to invest this Diwali?With prices soaring to record highs, the question everyone is asking is whether this Diwali is the right time to buy or if investors are chasing a fleeting festive rally.

Wipro shares plunge nearly 5% despite rise in Q2 net profit. Here's whyAt around 9:30 am, Wipro was trading at Rs 242.12 on the NSE, down 4.6%. The Nifty IT index slipped around 1.2%, weighed down by losses in both Wipro and Infosys.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid cautious trade; Asian Paints jumps over 3%At around 9:20 am, the S&P BSE Sensex slipped 112.93 points to 83,354.73, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.45 points at 25,542.85.

IMF chief says open trade key for India's continued economic riseIMF Director Kristalina Georgieva said that India stands out as one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and continues to make a major contribution to global growth because of its consistent reform efforts.

Canara HSBC Life listing today: What GMP hints about its debut on Dalal StreetThe IPO of Canara HSBC Life Insurance Company Limited was a book-built issue worth Rs 2,517.50 crore. It was entirely an offer-for-sale (OFS) of 23.75 crore shares.

Azoria CEO alleges ETF delisted after refusing to back firms hiring H-1B workersAzoria Capital's CEO alleges that his statement -- vowing not to invest in companies that replace American workers with H-1Bs -- led to a sudden move by the Board of Trustees of Tidal Trust III to delist the Azoria 500 Meritocracy ETF, a fund launched earlier this year.

Diwali Muhurat Trading 2025: Date, time and everything investors must knowThis year's Muhurat Trading will take place on Tuesday, October 21, 2025. The pre-open session will run from 1:30 pm to 1:45 pm, followed by the main trading window from 1:45 pm to 2:45 pm.

entertainment.headline: 52nd Daytime Emmy Awards announced, General Hospital wins seven trophies The 2025 edition of the Daytime Emmy Awards, hosted by Mario Lopez, was held at Pasadena Civic Auditorium, California.

Kajal Aggarwal celebrates sister Nisha's birthday with touching message Actor Kajal Aggarwal posted a touching birthday message for her sister Nisha Aggarwal on Instagram. The actor has completed shooting for 'The India Storry', a film based on true events involving pesticide scandals.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan says Shweta couldn't sleep after watching Kantara Rishabh Shetty recounted his humble beginnings and memorable moments in the film industry. Amitabh Bachchan praised Rishabh's performance in 'Kantara', sharing his daughter's strong reaction.

Taylor Swift donates $100,000 to young fan battling cancer with heartfelt message Pop sensation Taylor Swift donates USD 100,000 to a two-year-old fan, Lilah, undergoing cancer treatment. The donation came after Lilah's family shared her love for Swift on social media, sparking widespread attention.

Rashmika can't stop blushing as she's teased about engagement with Vijay. Watch Actor Rashmika Mandanna reacts to speculation about her engagement with Vijay Deverakonda. The pair's relationship continues to attract attention amid public appearances and online discussions.

Bhojpuri music is back in Hindi films but is Bollywood doing it dirty? From Panwadi to Aayi Nai, Bhojpuri beats are back in Bollywood. In this week's Cinematic Saturday we discuss if it is a true celebration of regional music or just another catchy imitation.

Salman praises Aryan Khan's debut, SRK's witty comeback steals the show Salman Khan commends Aryan Khan's directorial debut at Joy Forum in Riyadh. Shah Rukh Khan jokingly comments on Salman's potential future son.

Dangal actor Zaira Wasim gets married, shares post with husband Zaira Wasim, who left Bollywood in 2019 for religious reasons, announced her marriage with images from her nikaah ceremony.The former actor, known for her acclaimed roles in 'Dangal' and 'Secret Superstar', posted her first personal update in years.

From singing sensation to anti-hero: Decoding Amaal Mallik's Bigg Boss 19 arc Singer Amaal Mallik entered 'Bigg Boss 19' with a lot of promise. However, instead of emerging as a hero, his stint in the 'Bigg Boss 19' house has made him an anti-hero. Here's why.

BB19 episode 55: Amaal apologises to Farrhana; Baseer and Ashnoor receive letters In 'Bigg Boss 19' Episode 55, Amaal apologised to Farrhana after their heated conflict, bringing some relief to the house tensions. Meanwhile, Baseer and Ashnoor received emotional letters from their families.

Shah Rukh Khan adorably calls Salman Khan's family his own at Joy Forum 2025 Bollywood's three Khans - Shah Rukh, Salman, and Aamir, came together on the same stage at Joy Forum 2025, entertaining fans with their fun banter and friendly vibes.

Little devil: Zaheer Iqbal reacts to Sonakshi Sinha's Jatadhara trailer Zaheer Iqbal praised his wife Sonakshi Sinha after watching the trailer of her upcoming supernatural thriller 'Jatadhara', calling her a "little devil."

Rishab Shetty visits Varanasi, attends Ganga aarti after Kantara: Chapter 1 success Rishab Shetty visited Varanasi and attended the Ganga aarti to express gratitude for the massive success of 'Kantara: Chapter 1'.

Diljit Dosanjh's Charmer to feature Sanya Malhotra in a dreamy new avatar Sanya Malhotra teams up with Diljit Dosanjh for the music video of his new song 'Charmer' from the album 'Aura'. The stylish teaser still has fans excited to see their on-screen chemistry ahead of the video's release on Monday.

Zayn Marie shares adorable video with father Mansoor Khan: My abbu raising the bar Actor Zayn Marie Khan shared a playful father-daughter video with her filmmaker father, Mansoor Khan, winning hearts online.

Gauahar Khan reacts to Farrhana's Bigg Boss 19 gameplay, calls it fun Farrhana's bold move to shred Neelam's letter in 'Bigg Boss 19' sparked outrage and emotional clashes among housemates. Actor Gauahar Khan called the episode dramatic yet hilarious, highlighting the intense emotions and chaos inside the house.

Why is India watching Kantara Chapter 1: Inside Rishab Shetty's ode to faith, fire With 'Kantara: Chapter 1', Rishab Shetty shapes rooted cinema for a global audience. The film thrives on faith, community, and the language of emotion beyond words. It's grand, grounded, and glowing -- a reflection of India's enduring belief in home-grown stories.

Ek Deewane Ki... makers say PVR Inox favouring Thamma, cinema chain denies claim 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat' makers have accused PVR INOX of favouring 'Thamma' in screen distribution this Diwali. The dispute raises questions about fairness in multiplex film showcasing and may lead to regulatory intervention.

Kerala High Court to screen Haal amid A certificate, beef biryani row The Kerala High Court will view the Malayalam film 'Haal' during a hearing on a petition contesting the Censor Board's A certificate and suggested edits. The court's decision is expected to impact how sensitive film content is reviewed.

general news.headline: 3 Afghan cricketers killed in Pak air strike, cricket board withdraws from seriesThe Afghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) on Saturday claimed that three domestic cricketers were killed in a Pakistani airstrike in Paktika. In response, the ACB announced the cancellation of a tri-series that was scheduled to be held in Lahore and Rawalpindi in November.

Easy one for me to solve: Trump gloats about resolving Pak-Afghanistan conflictUS President Donald Trump said it would be "easy" for him to solve the ongoing Pakistan-Afghanistan conflict, claiming he has already resolved multiple global wars and "saved millions of lives."

Can Putin reach Hungary to meet Trump without being arrested or shot down?Putin-Trump meeting: While Trump and Putin have decided to meet in Hungary to discuss a possible end to the Ukraine conflict, the million-dollar question is how the Russian leader, who faces an arrest warrant, will reach Budapest.

Aadhaar card for British citizens? PM Starmer plans Brit Card with Indian DNABritish PM Keir Starmer lauded India's Aadhaar digital ID as a "huge success" and aims to draw lessons for the UK's own unique ID system. Unlike Aadhaar, Brit Card will not use biometric data and will initially target illegal employment.
What not to say to a diabetic this DiwaliIndia's obsession with sweets is such that even if you tell people you are diabetic, they will insist you have "just one piece".

All Afghans must return home, our land is for 250 million Pakistanis: Khawaja AsifPakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif said all Afghans must return home, declaring Pakistan's resources are for its own citizens, accusing Kabul of aiding terrorists and acting as a "proxy" for India.

BCCI, Centre can take tips: Priyanka Chaturvedi as Afghans call off Pak seriesThe swipe was a reference to India playing against Pakistan in the Asia Cup, which faced boycott calls on social media following the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack.

Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw unimpressed with IndiGo's gourmet cuisine menu, shares postBiocon chief Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw took a dig at IndiGo Airlines after being served what she called "tasteless" in-flight gourmet food. Her post soon sparked an online discussion on the quality of meals offered on domestic flights.

Thrice in 4 months: Why Bishnoi gang keeps attacking Kapil Sharma's Canada cafeKapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Surrey, Canada, has faced three targeted shootings this year by gangsters from the Lawrence Bishnoi network and Babbar Khalsa. The attacks reflect rising transnational gang violence and extortion threats in Surrey's South Asian community. Here is everything you need to know about the back-to-back attacks.

Had several disagreements with Rahul Dravid during selection meetings: AgarkarAjit Agarkar has revealed that he had disagreements with former India head coach Rahul Dravid during selection meetings. Dravid served as India's head coach from 2021 to 2024.

US man who assisted Hamas in Oct 7 attack arrested, FBI says he lied on visa formThe FBI arrested Louisiana resident Mahmoud Amin Ya'qub Al-Muhtadi for allegedly taking part in Hamas' October 7, 2023 attack on Israel and lying on his US visa application.

Salman praises Aryan Khan's debut, SRK's witty comeback steals the showSalman Khan commends Aryan Khan's directorial debut at Joy Forum in Riyadh. Shah Rukh Khan jokingly comments on Salman's potential future son.

Exclusive: It's a people's win, says Hyderabad doctor behind ORS label banIndia's food regulator has barred beverage makers from using the 'ORS' label on sugary drinks, ending an eight-year campaign by Hyderabad paediatrician Dr. Sivaranjani Santosh, who called the move "a people's win".

Karnataka official suspended for attending RSS event, BJP calls it unlawful moveA Karnataka government employee was suspended for participating in RSS centenary celebrations in Lingasugur. The BJP has called the move illegal and unlawful.
At least 3 Indians dead, 5 missing after boat capsizes in MozambiqueA launch boat carrying 14 Indian crew capsized near Beira port, Mozambique, killing at least three.

How Manav Subodh's 1M1B is turning young Indians into global climate leadersManav Subodh built 1M1B (1 Million for 1 Billion) from village pilot phases to a United Nations-linked movement. Now he trains youth in green skills, blends AI and local knowledge, and aims to convert India's youth dividend into climate action to keep global warming below 1.5°C.

Mitchell Marsh hopes Kohli and Rohit have a quiet ODI series vs AUS Australia captain Mitchell Marsh hopes Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma enjoy their probable last series on Australian soil but joked he prefers a quiet outing from the legends in the upcoming three-match ODI series.

New Zealand played some good cricket, but missed out on few moments: Ben SawyerNew Zealand coach Ben Sawyer said that his side has played some good cricket but missed out on a few moments during the competition. New Zealand will face Pakistan and will need a win to keep their top four hopes alive.

Tanvi Sharma first Indian woman since 2008 to bag World Junior Championships medalTanvi Sharma defeated Japan's Saki Matsumoto 13-15, 15-9, 15-10 in the quarterfinal and secured India's first medal in the BWF World Junior Championships since 2008.

Maaya Rajeshwaran, Sahaja Yamalapalli get wildcard entry for Chennai OpenSahaja Yamalapalli and Maaya Rajeshwaran have received wildcard entries for the WTA 250 Chennai Open. Yamalapalli recently made the headlines after beating US Open 2017 champion Sloane Stephens.

Inside Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Perth training ahead of ODI returnIndia tour of Australia: After taking part in an optional training session just hours after landing in Perth on Thursday, Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma had extended batting stints on Friday at Optus Stadium. Rohit was also seen engaging in detailed discussions with head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill.

Jadeja sends heartfelt message to wife Rivaba after becoming cabinet ministerRavindra Jadeja sent a heartfelt message to his wife Rivaba as she became part of the revamped Gujarat cabinet on Friday, October 17. Rivaba became one of the 25 ministers who were sworn in on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
